member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Commands.Products.SynchronizeAllProducts
member.summary:
Defines the back-end operations of the synchronize-all-products command. To synchronize all the products from and to external commerce systems, this command:
Extracts the language from the context parameters and specifies that the direction of the synchronization is both ways.
Uses the language and direction to create a synchronization request.
Passes this request as a parameter to the SynchronizeProducts method of the class.
This class inherits from the ProductSynchronizationCommand class.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Commands.Products.SynchronizeAllProducts.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Commands.Products.SynchronizeAllProducts.StartProcess(System.Object[])
member.summary: Starts the process of the synchronization. This method calls the SynchronizeProducts method of the class passing the language and demand to synchronize products both ways.
member.param: The parameters should include language as first parameter of the array.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Commands.Products.SynchronizeArtifacts
member.summary:
Defines the back-end operations of the synchronize-all-artifacts command. For example, artifacts can be products, manufacturers, categories, or specification. To synchronize all artifacts from and to external commerce systems, this command:
Extracts the language from the context parameters and specifies that the direction of the synchronization is both ways.
Uses the language and direction to create a synchronization request.
Passes this request as a parameter to the SynchronizeArtifacts method of the class.
This class inherits from the ProductSynchronizationCommand class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Starts the process of the synchronization. This method calls the SynchronizeArtifacts method of the class passing the language and demand to synchronize artifacts both ways.
member.param: The parameters should include language as first parameter of the array.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Commands.Products.SynchronizeProduct
member.summary:
Defines the back-end operations of the synchronize-single-product command. To synchronize a single product from and to external commerce systems, this command:
Extracts the language from the context parameters and specifies that the direction of the synchronization is both ways.
Uses the product identifier, the language and direction to create a synchronization request.
Passes this request as a parameter to the SynchronizeProduct method of the class.
This class inherits the ProductSynchronizationCommand class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary:
Determines whether to show, hide, or disable command in the ribbon. This method:
Disables the command if there is no product selected.
Hides the command if the current item does not represent a product.

member.summary: Gets the parameters from the command context.

member.summary:
Starts the process of the synchronization. This method calls the SynchronizeProduct method of the
passing the product id, language and demand to synchronize product both ways.
member.param: The parameters should include product ID as first parameter of the array and language as second parameter of the array.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Data.Products.ResourceTypes
member.summary:
Presents the constant values of the different types of the product resources. These constant values can be:
Images in the Media Library. In this case, the constant value is Image.
Non-image items in the Media Library, such as .zip and .pdf files. In this case, the constant value is Download.
The links to the external resources are also defined as downloads.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Commerce.Data.Products.ResourceTypes.Download
member.summary: The resource type: a download files, such as .zip and .pdf files.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Commerce.Data.Products.ResourceTypes.Image
member.summary: The resource type: image in Media Library.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Data.Products.ResourceRepository
member.summary:
Represents the repository that saves resources as items in the Media Library. This class:
Receives the stream of bytes that define a resource. This stream contains the name and the MIME-type of a resource.
Generates different types of items according to the MIME-type of the resource.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Prices.Price
member.summary: Represents the price of a product. The Price object indicates the value that a customer pays for a single product, but the Total object indicates the total cost, which includes additional items such as tax and shipping. The Pricing Service Provider uses the GetProductPrices to return the price. A product may be assigned multiple prices. You can use one single call to get a group of objects that represent the different prices.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Prices.Price.conditions
member.summary: Represents the conditions for a special price. Some special prices are applicable when certain conditions are met, for example, a campaign on a product, if the customer has bought at least five products, or a special date. You can use this property to define the conditions.

member.summary:

member.summary:
Gets or sets the type of the price.
List Price
Customer Price
The list price is the original price without any condition. The customer price is the price that the customer pays taking all conditions into account.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Pipelines.Carts.Common.TriggerCartLinesPageEvent
member.summary:
Defines the processor that triggers the page events when adding cart lines. The TriggerPageEventsForCartLines process is used by the following pipelines:
AddCartLines
RemoveCartLines
UpdateCartLines
The TriggerCartLinesPageEvent processor also registers the following values for a cart line:
The Product ID
The quantity
The price
The currency
The base class reads the name and text of the event. The specialized processor, in addition, adds information about the product ID, Quantity and Price to the event data.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Pipelines.Carts.ResumeCart.TriggerCartResumedPageEvent
member.summary:
Defines the processor that triggers a specified page event when resuming the cart and registers the following cart values:
ExternalCartId, which contains the ID of the cart in the external commerce system.
UserId, which contains the ID of the visitor in Sitecore.
CartName, which contains the name of the cart in Sitecore.
CartStatus, which contains the current state of the cart in the EA plan.
StateName, which contains the previous state of the cart.
The Page Event text is automatically localized using the Sitecore dictionary. The TriggerCartCreatedPageEventForResumedCart processor is used by the ResumeCart pipeline.

member.summary: Gets the name of the previous state. The previous state name is stored in the custom data by the CheckCanBeResumed processor.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Pipelines.Orders.TriggerOrderedProductStockStatusPageEvent
member.summary:
Defines the processor that triggers the page events when an order status changes. The TriggerOrderedProductStockStatusPageEvent process is used by the following pipelines:
OrderedProductStockStatus
The TriggerOrderedProductStockStatusPageEvent processor also registers the following values for an order:
The product id
Stock status
Pre-orderable
In-Stock Date
Shipping Date
The base class reads the name and text of the event. The specialized processor, in addition, adds information about the Product ID , Stock Status, Pre-orderable, In-Stock Date, Shipping Date, if and only if the Stock Status != InStock.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.EntityFactory
member.summary: Defines the entity factory that uses Sitecore mechanisms of dependency injection to instantiate objects according to their definitions in the configuration file. The dependency injection is handled by the class. Commerce entities are configured in the "//sitecore/commerce.Entities" node. This class inherits from the IEntityFactory interface.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.IEntityFactory
member.summary: Defines the interface that you can use to instantiate an object with a specific name. This name should be an identifier and not the name of the class name. The default implementation of this interface is the class. The class uses Sitecore mechanism of embedded dependency injection. to instantiate objects according to their definitions in the configuration file. In the file, Commerce entities are configured in the //sitecore/commerce.Entities node.

This method uses the facilities of the Sitecore embedded dependency injection mechanisms to instantiate objects according to their definitions in the configuration file. The dependency injection is handled by the class. Commerce entities are configured in the "//sitecore/commerce.Entities" node.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartAdjustment
member.summary:
Describes a charge or a discount on a , or a product on a cart line. Some examples are:
Coupon codes that are manually triggered on the cart or the cart line.
Shipping surcharges that are automatically triggered on the cart or cart Line.

member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of the adjustment.

member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the adjustment.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the adjustment is a charge.

member.summary: Gets or sets the line number.

member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage of the adjustment.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartLine
member.summary: Represents a line in the cart. Each line represents a product and the quantity of the product that a visitor has added to the cart. The CartLine class also represents the position of the line relative to other lines in the cart, which controls the order in which the lines appear when they are displayed.

member.name: F:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartLine.adjustments
member.summary: Represents a collection of adjustments that contains charges and discounts that are applied to the cart line.

item.description: Coupon codes that are manually triggered
Shipping charges that are automatically triggered

member.name: F:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartLine.subLines
member.summary: Represents the sublines on a cart line.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartLine.RemoveAllProperties
member.summary: Removes all properties.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartLine.Adjustments
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of adjustments that contains charges and discounts that are applied to the cart line. The actual content of the adjustments are provided by the external commerce system.

item.description: Coupon codes that are manually triggered
Shipping charges that are automatically triggered

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartLine.SubLines
member.summary: Gets or sets the cart line sublines.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartLine.Total
member.summary: Gets or sets the total of the cart line. It represents the total price of the product. If no break-pricing or other price adjustments are applied, this value is the same as the total price of the product (or subitem) multiplied by the quantity including the adjustments. It is reserved for the pricing service layer and you should not change its value when you add, remove, or update the cart lines.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartLine.Product
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that represents the actual product.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartLine.ExternalCartLineId
member.summary: Gets or sets the external cart line ID. It is a unique identifier for the cart line in the commerce system. It is empty when you add cart lines and can be set by the external commerce system. You can use it to remove or update cart lines.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartLine.LineNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the cart line ID. It is a unique identifier that represents the position of the cart line in the cart. It is empty when you add the cart line and is set by the external commerce system. You can use it to remove or update cart lines.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartLine.Quantity
member.summary: Gets or sets the quantity of a product in the cart line.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartOption
member.summary: Represents a configurable or variable value that is specific to a product in the cart. An example of an option is an engraving on a personalized product. When the engraving service is added to the cart, the text to be engraved is also required. The represents this. If an option has an additional charge, the option is represented as a separate total on a new cart line. The option is only used to describe variables or settings on a specific product, not adjustments or pricing changes.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartOption.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description. The description property is optional and explains the option, for example, "engraving" and "names on t-shirts."

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartOption.OptionId
member.summary: Gets or sets the internal ID of the option. The ID is typically provided by Sitecore when the user adds an option to the cart line.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Carts.CartOption.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the the actual custom value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the product price. You can assign a value to the Price property when you add or update cart lines in the cart. When the GetCartTotal pipeline is called, the Pricing service layer sets the product property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the product in-stock date. You can assign a value to the stock status property when you add or update cart lines in the cart.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Install.Localization.LocalizationPostStep
member.summary:
Defines the localization process that is run after the package installation. This process imports localization keys from XML-files, that are in the package, to the Core and Master databases. The following is an example for the format of the list files: "folder" - "temp", "files" - "Core\da-DK.xml;Core\de-DE.xml;Core\ja-JP.xml" In this example:
"folder" and "temp" are meta data files.
The XML files that are called da-DK, de-DE, and ja-JP are taken from the ~/temp/Core folder.
The localization keys are imported from these XML files.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Pipelines.Carts.Common.CheckIfLocked
member.summary:
Defines the processor that checks whether the cart is locked. If the cart is locked, the CheckIfLocked stops the pipeline. This processor returns an SystemMessages object to indicate the locked status. This processor is generic and all the pipelines that modify the cart content must use it. This processor is used by the following pipelines:
AddCartLines
RemoveCartLines
UpdateCartLines
DeleteCart
UpdateCart

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Pipelines.Carts.Common.SaveCartToEaState
member.summary:
Defines the processor that saves the cart data in the repository of the Automation states. You can use this processor as follows:
If the external commerce system does not persist carts or if the handling of the carts is entirely executed in Sitecore, you can use this processor separately in the SaveCart pipeline.
If Sitecore recognizes the visitor, the visitor can load and resume using the cart that is stored in the repository of the Automation states.
If the external commerce system does not support all the information specified in the cart's domain model. The main data is written to the external commerce system and this processor writes the remaining data to the repository.
This processor is used by the SaveCart pipeline.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Pipelines.Carts.CreateCart.CreateCart
member.summary: Defines the processor that creates a cart, initializes the values in it using the arguments, and returns it. If a cart with the same values already exists, the processor overwrites it. The default CreateCart processor is generic for creating a cart using the domain model and not the the external commerce system. In some integration scenarios, you must use the the external commerce system to create the cart. In this case, you can extend the CreateCart processor base class or replace it with another class. In other integration scenarios, the external commerce system does not create carts but rather manipulates cart lines or just saves carts. The implementation of the cart creation depends on the external commerce system that Sitecore is being integrated with.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Pipelines.Carts.CreateOrResumeCart.FindCartInEaState
member.summary:
Searches for a visitor cart in its current Engagement Automation (EA) state with the following input parameters:
UserID
CustomerID
CartName
ShopName
If a matching cart is found, the custom pipeline argument args.Request.Properties[CartID] is assigned to the the ID of the matching cart. In the CreateOrResumeCart pipeline, the RunLoadCart processor uses the cart ID stored in the custom data. You can use the FindCartInEaState processor to search and retrieve the ID of an existing cart before executing the RunLoadCart processor.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Pipelines.Carts.LoadCart.LoadCartFromEaState
member.summary:
Defines the processor that takes the ID of the cart, takes the name of the shop, and loads the cart from the Engagement Automation (EA) state. Because searching for a cart by ID across all visitors is time consuming, to overcome performance issues, the default implementation works as follows:
Carts are loaded from the data of the current visitor's EA state and filtered by the given parameters.
If the cart is found, the operation stops and the cart is returned.
If the cart is not found, all the carts of all the visitors are loaded and filtered by the given parameters.
If the cart is found, the operation stops and the cart is returned.
You can use this processor as follows:
If the external commerce system does not load carts or if the handling of the carts is entirely executed in Sitecore, you can use this processor separately in the LoadCart pipeline.
If Sitecore recognizes the visitor, they can automatically load and resume the cart that is stored in the repository of the Automation states.
If the external commerce system does not support all the information specified in the cart's domain model. The main data is loaded from the external commerce system and this processor loads the remaining data from the repository.
Abandoned carts might have been purged from the external commerce system but could still be in an EA state in Sitecore. In this case, you should use the LoadCartfromEaState and LoadCartfromExternalSystem processors in the pipeline, so that Sitecore is acting as a backup storage for carts.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Pipelines.Carts.ResumeCart.CheckCanBeResumed
member.summary:
Defines the processor that checks whether a cart can be resumed. If the visitor is not in the abandoned cart Engagement Automation (EA) plan and not in the initial state, the pipeline stops. This processor stores the values to the following parameters in the custom data:
CartSourceStateId, which is used by the MoveVisitorToInitialState processor.
CartDestinationStateId, which is used by the MoveVisitorToInitialState processor.
PreviousStateName, which is used by the TriggerCartResumedPageEvent processor.
The CheckCanBeResumed processor is used by the ResumeCart pipeline.

member.summary: The Engagement Automation (EA) plan provider.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CheckCanBeResumed class.

member.summary: Executes the business logic of the CheckCanBeResumed processor.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Pipelines.Carts.ResumeCart.MoveVisitorToInitialState
member.summary: Define a generic processor that moves the current visitor between two states of an EA plan. The MoveVisitorToInitialState processor is used by the ResumeCart pipeline to move the visitor to the initial state of the Abandoned Cart EA plan This processor uses the source and destination state IDs of the cart that are stored in the custom data by the CheckCanBeResumed processor.

member.summary: Executes the business logic of the MoveVisitorToInitialState processor.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Pipelines.Products.SynchronizeClassifications.ReadSitecoreClassifications

member.summary:
Defines a set of extensions for the class. The GenericCustomerServiceProviderExtensionsclass contains the same methods as in the class.
The methods of this class are:
Generic
Accept a custom request that is inherited from the default request
Return a custom result that is inherited from the default result
Implement the default constructor

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Prices.PriceCondition
member.summary: Represents a condition that must be met in order for a price to be applied. For every external commerce system, you must extend the PriceCondition class to support the actual ConditionTypes, operators and possible return values.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Prices.PriceCondition.ConditionType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the condition. quantity, date and total

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Prices.PriceCondition.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that describes the condition.
member.value: The text that describes the condition.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Prices.PriceCondition.Operator
member.summary: Gets or sets the operator that you can use to compare values in the condition. greater than, equal to, and between
member.value: The operator that you can use to compare values in the condition.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Prices.PriceCondition.Sequence
member.summary: Gets or sets the number that represents the sequential order of the condition.
member.value: The sequential order of the condition.

member.name: P:Sitecore.Commerce.Entities.Prices.PriceCondition.Value
member.summary:
Gets or sets the value. If the ConditionType is equals to Quantity, the value is typically:
A single integer with a logical operator like "greater than >", "less than <", "greater than or equal to >=" or "less than or equal to <="
or
A range like 5-10 with the operator "between"
If the ConditionType is equal to Date, the value is typically:
A single date with an operator like "greater than >", "less than <", "greater than or equal to >=" or "greater than or equal to <="
or
A date range like A - B with the operator "between"
member.value: The value that you use to compare the condition type with.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.CartServiceProvider
member.summary: Represents the interaction with the carts. Service providers are wrapper objects that ease the interaction with CommerceConnect pipelines. Service providers only implement the logic that calls pipelines. All the business logic is implemented in the pipeline's processors. Every method receives a request object and returns a result object, for example, GetCarts receives GetCartsRequest and returns GetCartsResult. To follow the best practice and ease the API optimization as implemented in the domain model, every class must be defined as an abstract class rather than an interface. The CartServiceProvider class implements the ServiceProvider class.
member.remarks: The Cart Provider methods call the cart pipelines to interact with the carts.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.CartServiceProvider.GetCarts(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.GetCartsRequest)
member.summary:
Gets the carts that match the specified criteria. The GetCards method calls the GetCart pipeline It queries the cart data in the external commerce system and gets a collection of CartBase objects that contains the summary of the main cart data. For example, you can use the GetCarts method to:
Get the carts for a specific visitor.
Get one of the carts for the current visitor in a multi-cart solution.
Get the carts that have not been used within a particular period, such as abandoned carts.
For more information, see the CartBase class.
member.param: A GetCartsRequest object that contains the search criteria.
member.returns: A group of objects that represent the queried carts.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.CartServiceProvider.CreateOrResumeCart(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.CreateOrResumeCartRequest)
member.summary:
Initiates the creation of a shopping cart and in the process, it :
Loads any persisted or abandoned cart.
Triggers events in DMS.
Enrolls the visitor in the Engagement Automation (EA) plan and stores the cart data in the AutomationStates object.
member.param: A CreateOrResumeCartRequest object that contains the cart ID and the shop name.
member.returns: A CartResult object that contains the created or resumed cart.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.CartServiceProvider.LoadCart(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.LoadCartRequest)
member.summary: Gets the details of a cart that is assigned to a Cart ID on a webshop. The LoadCart method calls the LoadCart pipeline and returns the full cart object with all associated cart lines.
member.param: A LoadCartRequest object that contains the cart ID and the shop name.
member.returns: A CartResult object that contains the loaded cart.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.CartServiceProvider.SaveCart(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.SaveCartRequest)
member.summary: Saves a cart in the external commerce system if supported and sets it to the Sitecore Engagement Automation (EA) state. It calls the SaveCart pipeline. You cannot call the SaveCart method directly. Other methods in the service layer call it when a specific cart needs to be saved. It is executed when you modify the cart, such as updating, adding, deleting cart lines and when you lock and unlock a cart.
member.param: A SaveCartRequest object contains the cart ID and the shop name.
member.returns: A ServiceProviderResult object that contains a group of messages that are received from the external commerce system.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.CartServiceProvider.AddCartLines(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.AddCartLinesRequest)
member.summary:
Adds the cart lines. It is called when you add a list of cart lines. On the user interface, it is called when the visitor clicks the Add to Cart button. The AddLinesToCart pipeline:
Adds lines on a cart, even if the lines that already exist on the cart contain the same products of the new lines.
Records the corresponding page event in the Digital Marketing System (DMS).
The AddLinestoCart pipeline executes the following processors:
CheckIfLocked
AddLinesToCart
RunSaveCart
TriggerPageEventsForCartLines
member.param: An AddCartLinesRequest object that contains the cart ID, the shop name and a collection of cart lines that you want to add.
member.returns: A CartResult object that contains a collection of messages that are received from the external commerce system.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.CartServiceProvider.RemoveCartLines(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.RemoveCartLinesRequest)
member.summary: Removes cart lines from a cart. It is called when you remove one or more cart lines from the shopping cart. On the user interface, it is called when the user updates the cart to remove one or more lines.
member.param: A RemoveCartLinesRequest that contains the cart ID, the shop name and a collection of cart lines to be removed.
member.returns: A CartResult object that contains the updated cart in the external commerce system.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.CartServiceProvider.UpdateCartLines(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.UpdateCartLinesRequest)
member.summary:
Updates the cart lines. It is called when you update the lines in a shopping cart. On the user interface, it is called when the user updates the cart of a specific product. This typically happens when a user:
Changes the quantity.
Adds a service, such as, insurance or shipping.
Enters a promotion code for a given product.
Replaces the product with another variant.
member.param: An UpdateCartLinesRequest object that contains the cart ID, the shop name and a group of cart lines that you want to update on the cart.
member.returns: A group of objects that represent the updated cart lines.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.CartServiceProvider.DeleteCart(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.DeleteCartRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes a cart permanently and triggers an event in DMS to inform that the cart is deleted. On the user interface, it is called:
When the user has gone through the scenario of paying, an order has been created and registered.
After a cart has been in the abandoned state for a particular period.
member.param: A DeleteCartRequest object that contains the cart ID and the shop name.
member.returns: A group of objects that represent the messages that are received from the external commerce system.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.CartServiceProvider.UpdateCart(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.UpdateCartRequest)
member.summary: Passes an updated cart to the external commerce system. It triggers an event in DMS to inform that the cart is being updated. The method is executed after any operation that modifies the cart, typically when an adjustment is made to a cart.
member.param: An UpdateCartRequest object that contains the cart ID and the shop name.
member.returns: A CartResult object that represents updated cart.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.CartServiceProvider.LockCart(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.LockCartRequest)
member.summary:
Sets the cart to the locked state where it is ready to be committed to an order. Before any optional payment transaction is performed, this method:
Sets the cart to locked and save it.
Triggers an event in DMS to inform that the cart is in the locked state.
When a cart is in the locked state, it indicates that you cannot use other service layer methods to modify the shopping cart content. you can lock the cart to prevent further changes in the cart before submitting the order. For example, the LockCart method is called during the checkout process, just before any payment transaction is executed and before turning the cart into an order. On the user interface, it is triggered when a user in the checkout flow has confirmed the cart's content. There is a corresponding UnlockCart method.
member.param: A LockCartRequest object that contains the cart ID and the shop name.
member.returns: A CartResult object that represents the locked cart.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.CartServiceProvider.UnlockCart(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.UnlockCartRequest)
member.summary: Sets the cart in the unlocked state, saves it, and triggers an event in DMS to inform that the cart is in the unlocked state. If a cart is in the unlocked state, it is editable. It is typically called if user returns to the cart and decides to modify the content after starting the checkout process and payment transaction. There is a corresponding LockCart method.
member.param: A UnlockCartRequest object that contains the cart ID and the shop name.
member.returns: A CartResult object that represents the unlocked cart.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.CartServiceProvider.MergeCart(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Carts.MergeCartRequest)
member.summary: Merges the carts. Called to merge an anonymous cart to a user cart.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Orders.OrderServiceProvider
member.summary: Represents the interaction with the orders. Service providers are wrapper objects that ease the interaction with Commerce Connect pipelines. Service providers only implement the logic that calls pipelines. All the business logic is implemented in the pipeline's processors. Every method receives a request object and returns a result object, for example, SubmitVisitorOrder receives SubmitVisitorOrderRequest and returns SubmitVisitorOrderResult. To follow the best practice and ease the API optimization as implemented in the domain model, every class must be defined as an abstract class rather than an interface. The OrderServiceProvider class implements the ServiceProvider class.
member.remarks: The Order Provider methods call the order pipelines to interact with the carts.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Products.Generics.GenericProductSynchronizationProviderExtensions
member.summary:
Defines a set of extensions for the class. The GenericProductSynchronizationProviderExtensions contains the same methods as in the class.
The methods of this class:
Are Generic
Accept a custom request that is inherited from the default request
Return a custom result that is inherited from the default result
Implement the default constructor

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Products.ProductSynchronizationProvider
member.summary: Defines the provider that is used to perform any product or artifact synchronization activity between Sitecore CMS and the external commerce system. It runs the corresponding pipelines that delegate the task to the processors. The ProductSynchronizationProvider class inherits from the class.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Products.SynchronizationContext
member.summary: Defines the synchronization context. This class Utilizes some of the Sitecore CMS facilities to speed up the synchronization of the artifacts between Sitecore CMS and the external commerce system. You can use this class to disable proxies, the event handling, and database cache. You can also use it to update all items in the content tree at once.

member.name: T:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Prices.PricingServiceProvider
member.summary: Represents the interaction with the pricing service. Service providers are wrapper objects that ease the interaction with the implementation pipelines. The providers only implement the calling pipelines. All the business logic is implemented in the pipeline processors. The PricingServiceProvider class implements the ServiceProvider class.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Prices.PricingServiceProvider.GetProductPrices(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Prices.GetProductPricesRequest)
member.summary: Gets the prices of a specific product. It is called when Sitecore needs the prices for a specific product.
member.param: A GetProductPricesRequest object that contains the user's ID, currency code, location, quantity, date time, shop name, and price type IDs.
member.returns: A group of objects that contain the prices and the messages that are received from the external commerce systems.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Prices.PricingServiceProvider.GetProductBulkPrices(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Prices.GetProductBulkPricesRequest)
member.summary: Gets the price for a specific cart. It is called when Sitecore needs the price for a specific cart.

member.name: M:Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Prices.PricingServiceProvider.GetCartTotal(Sitecore.Commerce.Services.Prices.GetCartTotalRequest)
member.summary: Gets the cart total.
member.param: A GetCartTotalRequest object that contains the cart, user's ID, currency code, location, shop name, and date time.
member.returns: A group of objects that contain the prices and the messages that are received from the external commerce systems.
